definition: to build by laying bricks or stones
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
lit. to pile up (bricks)/to pack/fig. to pad out (writing with fancy phrases)/ornate rhetoric
to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
to make an accusation based on fabricated evidence (idiom)

sentences.english: The oven is made of bricks and the meat is roasted over it. It is called BBQ in short.
sentences.chinese: 炉子是砖砌的，可在炉子上烤肉，简称BBQ。

sentences.english: Heavy masonry infills start immediately above the commercial floor.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的砌面填料马上压向商用楼层。

sentences.english: Why the net my eyes, build lower source lotus.
sentences.chinese: 何以净我眼，砌下生白莲。

sentences.english: A car made of bricks is displayed on street in Jiangyin, a city of east China's Jiangsu Province.
sentences.chinese: 江苏省江阴街上，展示了一辆砖砌宝马车。

sentences.english: Eskimoes form igloos out of blocks of ice.
sentences.chinese: 爱斯基摩人用冰块砌圆顶冰舍。

sentences.english: The wall was now nearly upon a level with my breast.
sentences.chinese: 这时砌得差不多齐胸了。

sentences.english: They also made sure to build the panda's cage out of Chinese dry wall.
sentences.chinese: 他们还给熊猫砌中国式的清水墙在笼子里。

sentences.english: They often use bricks to build houses.
sentences.chinese: 他们常使用砖块砌房子。

sentences.english: In these houses, there were kangs, built of stone or brick.
sentences.chinese: 这些房子里有石头或砖砌的炕。

sentences.english: If you choose to build a wall around your heart, make it low enough for love to climb over.
sentences.chinese: 如果要筑起心墙，也记得砌低点，好让爱还能翻过来。

sentences.english: He built in bookcases between the windows.
sentences.chinese: 他在窗户之间砌了嵌入式书架。

sentences.english: In addition, the permitted along the gable of the two characters on stage lined with statues Ocean 500.
sentences.chinese: 此外，沿着佛殿两山墙砌台上还排列着五百罗汉塑像。

sentences.english: A brick-structured water tower under complicated environmental conditions was demolished by the use of directional blasting.
sentences.chinese: 用定向爆破法拆除了处于复杂环境中的一砖砌水塔。

sentences.english: Ling Ling puzzle night, cold smoke and months, horizontal, slanting windows.
sentences.chinese: 泠泠砌夜，冷烟和月，疏影横窗。

sentences.english: The highness of the wall prevents thieves from entering.
sentences.chinese: 那垛墙砌得很高，可防止窃贼进入。

sentences.english: The house is buit of brick.

definition: to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
